info.title: Logistics API
info.description:
Module responsible for shipping calculation and inventory control.

The variable {{environment}} can be filled with vtexcommercestable or vtexcommercebeta, depending on the environment you want to test.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description:
This endpoint lists existing [shipping policies](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/shipping-policy--tutorials_140) from carriers in your store, searching by their IDs.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns **Scheduled Delivery** related time fields adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the shipping policy.

delete.description: This endpoint deletes existing shipping policies from carriers in your store, searching by their IDs.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the shipping policy.

put.description:
This endpoint updates information on existing Shipping Policies from carriers.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns **Scheduled Delivery** related time fields adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Shipping policy's ID

shippingMethod.title: shippingMethod
shippingMethod.description: Type of shipping available for this shipping policy (carrier). Options shown on freight simulation.

deliveryOnWeekends.title: deliveryOnWeekends
deliveryOnWeekends.description: If the shipping policy (carrier) delivers on weekends

maxDimension.title: maxDimension
maxDimension.description: Object containing attributes of maximum dimension permitted by the shipping policy (carrier).

maxMeasureSum.title: maxMeasureSum
maxMeasureSum.description: Sum of all maximum measures of the package.

isActive.title: isActive
isActive.description: If the shipping policy is active or not.

deliveryScheduleSettings.description: Settings for the Scheduled Delivery feature.

maxRangeDelivery.description: Range of days available within a delivery window, for the customer to choose the scheduled delivery. For example, if the configured maxRangeDelivery is equal 7, and the customer buys something on a Tuesday, the options for scheduled delivery will be shown until the following Tuesday (7 days from the purchase day). If no options are available within the maxRangeDelivery set, this shipping policy won't be shown on the checkout.

dayOfWeekForDelivery.description: Select the chosen days for delivery. Values for each day of the week are: 0 = sunday, 1 = monday, 2 = tuesday, 3 = wednesday, 4 = thursday, 5 = friday, 6 = saturday. Make sure to add the available hours for the chosen days, following the example.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week, from `0` (sunday) to `6` (saturday).

startTime.title: startTime
startTime.description: Start time for day of the week.

endTime.description: End time for day of the week.

listPrice.description: List price for day of the week.

deliveryCapacity.description: Sets maximum delivery capacity for a given reservation window for scheduled delivery.

capacityType.description: Defines how the delivery capacity is measured for this reservation window, by maximum number of orders (`"ORDERS_QUANTITY"`) or SKUs (`"SKUS_QUANTITY"`).

maxValue.description: Maximum number of orders or SKUs that the store is capable of fulfilling.

get.description:
This endpoint lists existing shipping policies from carriers in your store.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns **Scheduled Delivery** related time fields adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Desired number of pages to retrieve information from your Shipping Policies.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Desired number of items per page, to retrieve information from your Shipping Policies.

post.description:
This endpoint creates new shipping policies from carriers in your store.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns **Scheduled Delivery** related time fields adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

shippingMethod.title: shippingMethod
shippingMethod.description: Type of shipping available for this shipping policy (carrier). Options shown on freight simulation

weekendAndHolidays.title: weekendAndHolidays
weekendAndHolidays.description: If the shipping policy includes deliveries on weekends and holidays.

saturday.title: saturday
saturday.description: Does the shipping policy allow deliveries on saturdays?

sunday.title: sunday
sunday.description: Does the shipping policy allow deliveries on sundays?

holiday.title: holiday
holiday.description: Does the shipping policy allow deliveries onholidays?

maxDimension.title: maxDimension
maxDimension.description: Object containing attributes of maximum dimension permitted by the shipping policy (carrier).

maxMeasureSum.title: maxMeasureSum
maxMeasureSum.description: Sum of all maximum measures of the package.

numberOfItemsPerShipment.title: numberOfItemsPerShipment
numberOfItemsPerShipment.description: Capacity of your store's logistics of shipment, determines number of items permitted per shipment.

minimumValueAceptable.title: minimumValueAceptable
minimumValueAceptable.description: Minimum value accepted by the carrier, to realize the shipping.

maximumValueAceptable.title: maximumValueAceptable
maximumValueAceptable.description: Maximum value accepted by the carrier, to realize the shipping.

deliveryScheduleSettings.title: deliveryScheduleSettings
deliveryScheduleSettings.description: Settings for the Scheduled Delivery feature.

maxRangeDelivery.title: maxRangeDelivery
maxRangeDelivery.description: Range of days available within a delivery window, for the customer to choose the scheduled delivery. For example, if the configured maxRangeDelivery is equal 7, and the customer buys something on a Tuesday, the options for scheduled delivery will be shown until the following Tuesday (7 days from the purchase day). If no options are available within the maxRangeDelivery set, this shipping policy won't be shown on the checkout.

dayOfWeekForDelivery.title: dayOfWeekForDelivery
dayOfWeekForDelivery.description: Select the chosen days for delivery. Values for each day of the week are: 0 = sunday, 1 = monday, 2 = tuesday, 3 = wednesday, 4 = thursday, 5 = friday, 6 = saturday. Make sure to add the available hours for the chosen days, following the example.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week, from `0` (sunday) to `6` (saturday).

startTime.title: startTime
startTime.description: Start time for day of the week.

endTime.description: End time for day of the week.

listPrice.description: List price for day of the week.

deliveryCapacity.description: Sets maximum delivery capacity for a given reservation window for scheduled delivery.

capacityType.description: Defines how the delivery capacity is measured for this reservation window, by maximum number of orders (`"ORDERS_QUANTITY"`) or SKUs (`"SKUS_QUANTITY"`).

maxValue.description: Maximum number of orders or SKUs that the store is capable of fulfilling.

carrierSchedule.title: carrierSchedule
carrierSchedule.description: Schedule sent by the carrier, to configure Shipping policy

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week, from `0` (sunday) to `6` (saturday).

cubicWeightSettings.title: cubicWeightSettings
cubicWeightSettings.description: Measure that accounts package's volume, and not only weight.

volumetricFactor.title: volumetricFactor
volumetricFactor.description: Factor that will be used on the cubic weight calculation.

modalSettings.title: modalSettings
modalSettings.description: Configurations for the [modal](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-does-the-modal-work--tutorials_125), which is the attachement of a specific product to a carrier specialized in delivering that type of product.

useOnlyItemsWithDefinedModal.title: useOnlyItemsWithDefinedModal
useOnlyItemsWithDefinedModal.description: When set as `true`, the modal's configurations will apply only for items with a defined modal.

carrierBusinessHours.title: carrierBusinessHours
carrierBusinessHours.description: Array containing objects with business hour configurations.

dayOfWeek.title: dayOfWeek
dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week, from `0` (sunday) to `6` (saturday).

isOpenOutsideBusinessHours.title: isOpenOutsideBusinessHours
isOpenOutsideBusinessHours.description: Select whether the shipping policy allows deliveries outside business hours.

pickupPointIds.title: pickupPointIds
pickupPointIds.description: Insert the IDs for pickup points previously configured in your store.

pickupPointTags.title: pickupPointTags
pickupPointTags.description: Insert the tags for pickup points previously configured in your store.

sellers.title: sellers
sellers.description: Sellers that will be associated with the [pickup points](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R) of the shipping policy being created.

isActive.description: Indicates whether shipping policy is active or not.

post.description: Creates or updates the freight values of your store's carriers. Learn more in [Shipping rate template](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/planilha-de-frete--tutorials_127#).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

schema.description: Array of objects, each containing information on a specific freight interval.

absoluteMoneyCost.description: Fixed shipping cost to be charged in a decimal number.

country.description: Three letter ISO code for the country where the delivery will take place.

maxVolume.description: Maximum volume that can be transported by the carrier in cm.

operationType.description: Indicates desired action for the object. Possible values are `1` (Insert), `2` (Update) or `3`(Delete).

pricePercent.description: [Price-based additional shipping charge](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/additional-shipping-costs--2vqGwMn0LabkOHY6zSHYNV), calculated based on the total price of the order, in decimal number. You must fill in this field with a percentage value. For example, for an additional charge of 10%, fill in the table with 10.

pricePercentByWeight.description: [Weight-based additional shipping charge](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/additional-shipping-costs--2vqGwMn0LabkOHY6zSHYNV), calculated based on the total weight of the order.

timeCost.description: Delivery time frame informed by the carrier, in the format DD.HH:MM:SS.

polygon.description: Polygon ID, according to the [geolocation](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/registering-geolocation/) feature.

get.description: Lists freight values apointed to your store's carriers, searching by carrier ID and postal code (`cep`).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: carrierId
parameters.description: Carrier ID

parameters.name: cep
parameters.description: Postal code.

get.description:
Lists all blocked delivery windows of your store's shipping policies, searching by carrier ID.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns **Scheduled Delivery** related time fields adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

post.description:
Adds blocked delivery windows for your store's shipping policies.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns time adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

post.description:
Removes the blocked delivery windows set to your store's shipping policies.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns time adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

get.description: Lists information about all warehouses set up in your store.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

items.title: WarehouseDock1
items.description: Information related to the docks available for the given warehouse.

time.description: This field returns the dock's processing time in days and hours. If none is configured, the request returns `00:00:00`.

cost.description: Extra charges added to the shipping rate when **Additional shipping costs** are configured.

warehouseDocks.description: Information related to the docks available for the warehouses.

pickupPointIds.description: This field returns a list of the [pickup points' IDs](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R) associated with the given warehouse.

priority.description: If the warehouse was configured as a priority. When no priority was set, the value returns`0`.

isActive.description: Shows if the warehouse is active (`true`) or inactive (`false`).

get.description: Lists the information of a given warehouse, searching by warehouse ID.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

pickupPointIds.description: This field returns a list of the [pickup points' IDs](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R) associated with the given warehouse.

priority.description: If the warehouse was configured as a priority. When no priority was set, the value returns`0`.

isActive.description: Shows if the warehouse is active (`true`) or inactive (`false`).

delete.description: Deletes given warehouse by warehouse ID.

get.description: Lists inventory information per warehouse on your store.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

availableQuantity.description: Amount of items available for sale. Difference between total quantity and reserved quantity.

isUnlimited.description: Indicates whether the SKU's availability is unlimited ("infinite inventory").

dateOfSupplyUtc.description: Date of supply lot in UTC.

keepSellingAfterExpiration.description: Indicates whether SKU can continue to be sold after the available quantity gets to 0.

put.summary: Update inventory by SKU and warehouse
put.description: Updates inventory for a given SKU and warehouse.

parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

dateUtcOnBalanceSystem.description: Defines the corresponding moment to the informed warehouse. It is useful due to the liberation of handling order reservations. If not sent or `null`, indicates that the registered date and time should be the same as that of when the request is sent.

put.description:
Creates a new Supply Lot. A Supply Lot lets the store sell products that are not currently available in stock but whose arrival is already scheduled.

Check out our [documentation](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/setting-up-future-inventory--UMSGjooqRfkRbeoh94kS4) about this feature.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: skuId
parameters.description: ID of the SKU whose availability is being scheduled.

parameters.name: warehouseId
parameters.description: ID of the warehouse where the SKU will arrive.

parameters.name: supplyLotId
parameters.description: ID of the Supply Lot in which the SKU's scheduling should be considered.

post.description:
Transfers an SKU from a Supply Lot to the currently available inventory.

Check out how this transfer works in further detail by reading our [documentation](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/configurar-estoque-futuro--UMSGjooqRfkRbeoh94kS4) about this feature.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: skuId
parameters.description: ID of the SKU.

parameters.name: warehouseId
parameters.description: ID of the warehouse where the SKU is located.

parameters.name: supplyLotId
parameters.description: ID of the Supply Lot in which the SKU is currently located and from where it will be transfered.

get.summary: Search capacity reservations in time range
get.description:
Get information on all capacity reservations made to scheduled delivery windows in a given time range.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns time adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

> Note that the combined string `carrier@{capacityType}@{shippingPolicyId}` can be referred to as a "resource" in the API's messages.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: capacityType
parameters.description: How the delivery capacity is measured as defined in the shipping policy. Capacity can be measured by maximum number of orders (`"orders_quantity"`) or SKUs (`"skus_quantity"`).

parameters.name: shippingPolicyId
parameters.description: ID of shipping policy to search.

parameters.name: rangeStart
parameters.description: Starting date of time range

parameters.name: rangeEnd
parameters.description: End date of time range.

get.summary: Get capacity reservation usage by window
get.description:
Retrieves capacity usage of a specific scheduled delivery reservation window.

> Note that, while most of our API endpoints return time fields in UTC, this endpoint returns time adjusted to the configured time zone of the account.

> Note that the combined string `carrier@{capacityType}@{shippingPolicyId}` can be referred to as a "resource" in the API's messages.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand

parameters.name: capacityType
parameters.description: How the delivery capacity is measured as defined in the shipping policy. Capacity can be measured by maximum number of orders (`"orders_quantity"`) or SKUs (`"skus_quantity"`).

parameters.name: shippingPolicyId
parameters.description: ID of shipping policy to search.

parameters.name: windowDay
parameters.description: Day of the specific scheduled delivery window to be consulted for reservations.

parameters.name: windowStartTime
parameters.description: Start time of specific scheduled delivery window to be consulted for reservations.

parameters.name: windowEndTime
parameters.description: End time of specific scheduled delivery window to be consulted for reservations.

dayOfWeekForDelivery.description: Select the chosen days for delivery. Values for each day of the week are: 0 = sunday, 1 = monday, 2 = tuesday, 3 = wednesday, 4 = thursday, 5 = friday, 6 = saturday. Make sure to add the available hours for the chosen days, following the example.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week, from `0` (sunday) to `6` (saturday).

startTime.title: startTime
startTime.description: Start time for day of the week.

endTime.description: End time for day of the week.

listPrice.description: List price for day of the week.

deliveryCapacity.description: Sets maximum delivery capacity for a given reservation window for scheduled delivery.

capacityType.description: Defines how the delivery capacity is measured for this reservation window, by maximum number of orders (`"ORDERS_QUANTITY"`) or SKUs (`"SKUS_QUANTITY"`).

maxValue.description: Maximum number of orders or SKUs that the store is capable of fulfilling.
